snippet: The two civilians killed in the explosions and gunfire were a Canadian and an Indonesian, senior officials reported. Five assailants were also killed.
abstract: Jakarta terrorist attack which killed 7 people is claimed by Islamic State, whose Indonesian adherents increasingly operate domestically; suspected organizer is Indonesian citizen thought to be in Syria, which has drawn droves of Indonesian militants to fight in civil war.

byline.original: By JOE COCHRANE and THOMAS FULLER
byline.contributor: Joe Cochrane reported from Jakarta, and Thomas Fuller from Bangkok. Reporting was contributed by Patrick Boehler and Michael Forsythe from Hong Kong, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations, Ian Austen from Ottawa, and Rukmini Callimachi from New York.

lead_paragraph: The two civilians killed in the explosions and gunfire were a Canadian and an Indonesian, senior officials reported. Five assailants were also killed.

headline.main: Jakarta Attack Raises Fears of ISIS’ Spread in Southeast Asia
headline.print_headline: Jakarta Attack Raises Fears That ISIS Is Spreading in Southeast Asia

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
